website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's slightly upgraded entry-level Fire 7 tablet remains a good value, but you're still better off spending a bit more for the HD 8 instead.
pros: The Amazon Fire 7 is inexpensive, has a standard headphone jack and houses a microSD card slot expandable up to 512GB
This 2019 edition has an upgraded processor and adds support for hands-free Alexa
Amazon Prime members can access the bevy of free TV shows, movies and games included with their $119 (£79) annual subscription
cons: App store doesn't have quite as much variety as Google Play Store
To truly take advantage of what the tablet has to offer, you need an Amazon Prime membership

customer_reviews.title: Questionable battery life
customer_reviews.text: Good budget tablet but the battery drains continuously when idle at a fast rate (10% daily)

customer_reviews.title: This is not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised by how bad this product is given the overall decent quality of Amazon products. The screen is unresponsive and freezes. Don't do like I did being cheap, swing the extra for the 8 or higher. You'll be happier in the long run.

customer_reviews.author: Denny B.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Font Size Options - Full of Crapware - all I want is an e-reader - this is not it!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike my Kindle Paperwhite, the FIre 7 has very few font size options, and all are way too small. This lack of large font sizes is enough of an issue to send this back. The other reason to send this back is it is loaded with crapware, and Amazon does not let you delete unwanted apps. I paid extra for "no special offers," but this tablet is loaded with crap. customer_reviews.author: Colorado Steve

customer_reviews.title: Kindle “fire” gets REALLY HOT
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has had this for 4 days and when I picked it up to put it away as she was getting ready for bed, the back was VERY, VERY hot. I am very glad she hadn’t been touching it. It was not charging, it was on, but idle. I feel like that should be addressed as a safety concern, seeing as so many of these customers are clearly buying these for children.
customer_reviews.author: Gavett Burch

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I received this tablet a few days ago and I can say it’s great for the price. I purchased this strictly for entertainment purposes (Netflix, kindle, youtube, etc.). It’s the perfect size and fits perfectly in my hands. I do wish the charging port and headphone jack were at the bottom of the tablet, instead of the top (as the top of the tablet is crowded with buttons and ports). Video quality is decent, not great, but for $50 I can’t complain. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a smaller, affordable tablet that they can use for video, reading, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Hise

customer_reviews.title: Good successor to the original Kindle Fire but beware of lower "special offers" price
customer_reviews.text: I got this new Kindle Fire as a replacement for the original Kindle Fire of several years ago, which still works fine but I wanted a faster processor and nicer display. For the price, this new Kindle is great. But I got the offer with the discount of "special offers" and I really didn't know what that meant. Then I figured out that it meant I would get ads on my display very often, which I had to click to dismiss and there was no way to turn off. In the end, I ended up paying Amazon an extra $15 plus tax to "unsubscribe" from the "special offers".
customer_reviews.author: Jorge A. Pita

customer_reviews.title: Like ads on your lock screen? This isn't a sale.
customer_reviews.text: There was no clear warning before purchasing that buying this product at sale price meant it would forever have ads on the lock screen. If you want them removed, you have to pay back the $15 discount on the device. This is shady business, tricking customers into thinking they were getting a good deal and then not clearly providing information that there would be ads.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Amos

customer_reviews.title: Needs full Android OS
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I Love the new Fire 7 (2019), the only thing I dislike, so far, is Amazon does not use the full Android OS. Because Amazon refuses to use the full Android OS I can not get or use some of my favorite Apps. They are now only available on Google Play, and Amazon does not allow use of Android Apps if they are on Google Play. Apps like Trivago, Amtrack, 7-11 Rewards, MyTuner Radio, or iTranslate just to mention a few I have tried to switch from my old Fire 6 to my new Fire 7 but are no longer available on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is terrible! Seriously, buy something else. I can’t believe that this is the new version. The 1gb of ram is barely enough to run its own operating system standing still. It takes about 2/3 of the ram to sit doing nothing. Anything that you try to do, web browsing, reading, anything even it’s own apps, will over tax your system. I’ve owned other Fire tablets in the past and this one is worse out of the box than those were when I got rid of them.
customer_reviews.author: Williams_79

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I really like that alexa is now hands free that's the main reason I updated my old kindle fire , on my old fire I had to walk over to adjust volume or push a button to talk to alexa but on this new one I can stay where I am and ask alexa to turn up the volume or skip songs
customer_reviews.author: yavon

customer_reviews.title: High hopes but ultimately let down

The touchscreen was not very responsive and I had to swipe or tap many times to get anything to register. At work I tried to connect my speaker via bluetooth but the it would not work. The bluetooth on the kindle couldn't sync with anything. At this point I reset to the factory settings, boxed it back up and returned.

customer_reviews.title: All New Fire 7

customer_reviews.author: Don Douds

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.

That aside, the tablet is ALWAYS pushing crappy apps with the close screen advertising. For the price, there are much more versatile and higher quality tablets out there... I got it as a prime day deal, but 3-10 would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Nice and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Always a fan of the Kindle. This new 2019 Kindle 7 is awesome. The emojis are up to date. Speed is better. Everything about it is better except for 2 things. I don't feel that the battery is any better (that's why I took away one star under the battery life section). I wish the camera was better but it's same old one. An upgrade of the camera would be nice. I'm still very happy with it tho.
customer_reviews.author: BTX

customer_reviews.title: Very Slow
customer_reviews.text: I have a fire 7 from way back. Just got the new fire 7. The new one is much slower. I have to swipe many times to get to the main menu. What's with all those Amazon icons. I can't get rid of them. I could on my old fire. Rough time downloading a book from my library. Very quick and easy on my old fire. The battery life is very poor. Much better on my old fire. Very disappointed. Think I go back to my old fire and forget the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Louis N Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Very slow, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I own each size and latest model of the Fire Tablets. I have to say that the 7 and the HD 8-models are just way too slow compared to the HD 10. These are honestly not worth the money until they upgrade these devices with AT LEAST the processor and RAM that the HD 10 has. They definitely need to do some updating/upgrading on internal parts. However, for $29 as an Amazon Prime Member, you get what you pay for. I don't recommend the 7 or HD 8 until some upgrades happen. With this being said, I am hoping for some huge changes on the next model(s)!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size as it is easy to handle and read. It is much improved over my older Kindle Fire with all of the apps and conveniences. I use it mostly to read books but it has many more uses. I purchased a case with it and like the fact that it goes to sleep when I close the cover. I haven't actually used the camera that much but was impressed with the fact that it actually has one. I would recommend this tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Neely

customer_reviews.title: It's a "you get what you pay for" kind of a thing.
customer_reviews.text: Annoying ads that appear every time you turn it on or wake it that have to be dismissed to use the tablet. Many apps you're used to not available: LastPass, for instance (and it's essential for me), and no real choice of browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Vivaldi, etc are not available. The main reason I got this is to use as an inexpensive way to access my cable channels in the kitchen using Cox cable's Contour app. It will inexplicably stop playing after some minutes, needing to be restarted. It's possible that this is an issue with Contour, but this never happens when using it on my android, iPhone or iPad.

One notable event, was the battery life. I was surprised by how low the battery level became in such a short time. It will find uses in my life. Was mosDef worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Drains While Idle
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Kindle and until just recently I’ve never had a problem. I don’t know what they’ve done but the battery drains when it’s not in use. Maybe it’s the ads, maybe it’s the WiFi, maybe it’s an app running, whatever it is it’s frustrating. I’m always picking up a dead Kindle. I’m glad it was inexpensive because I’m not keeping it much longer. They’ve ruined a good product in my opinion.

customer_reviews.author: David m.

customer_reviews.title: battery does not perform
customer_reviews.text: I had one a few years ago and ran into a problem with charging the device. I tried various solutions with no success. A few months ago I decided to try a new one. Surely they had improved. But no. Let me say the device itself is fine. My use is fairly basic and it does what I need it to. As long as I can keep it charged! It recharges at a snail's pace and then quickly drains power when used. You may want to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not a fully functioning tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan at all. It will not download DJI Go 4 app, which is the only reason I got this to begin with. However, there are more issues at hand. Firstly, It doesn’t use the Play store, so make sure to research that the Fire tablet can utilize some of your Android favorites. There’s a huge delay in the touch screen response. Lastly, and the most important issue, is that the tablet will display pop-up Ads on the lock screen, home screen, and even while using the Device. So be prepared to see pop-up ads while watching an Ad on the YouTube App. The battery life is average.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Pretty terrible battery life. The only reason I got this was because my original Kindle Fire from 2012 doesn't have bluetooth capability. The original has stellar battery life. Can leave it on but sleeping for a month and come back to it and it will wake right up. This one I feel like I have to charge it at least every other day. What happened in the last 8 years Amazon? Shouldn't battery life improve as technology improves? Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: I wish to hear bros the thing but wouldnt!
customer_reviews.text: I can't look at any article, play any game without it spitting me out to back where I started! Again and again, the same thing. I've tried reopening the app but no change! It is a brand new tablet so I don't understand what it could be. It is so frustrating to begin something and suddenly it closes or returns you back to where you were.
customer_reviews.author: charisse dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Awful in just about every way
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the tablet they issue in purgatory. It’s laggy, semi responsive, full of ads, and worst of all half it’s battery is used up in standby over 24hr period. It’s like a tablet that’s subpar in every way. Glad I only use this to monitor amazon cloud cams because it doesn’t have apps for any other camera providers. In fact it doesn’t have 99% of the apps in droid or iOS stores. It didn’t even have YouTube until July 2019! It doesn’t even have native apps for their very own blink cam! Update June 2020: Loading a simple webpage which loads in sub-milliseconds on iPad takes 20 seconds on this device. So AWFUL.
customer_reviews.author: Edih

customer_reviews.title: Speaker on back.
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy watching all my shows on this tablet! I still have to download games to see how the RPG are and other arcade games. The only down side is the speaker to the tablet. It’s kinda behind or in the back of the tablet so you don’t get the volume towards you. You need to turn up the volume. Also you might want to get a case for the tablet. Especially if you have kids. The tablet feels kinda fragile if it is drop. So best be safe with a case.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Chong

customer_reviews.title: Good budget tablet, but battery drains at a rapid rate.
customer_reviews.text: It works great so far and so far I have not had any problems. The battery doesn't seem to last as long as it claims, but I've only charged it a couple of times since I received it. Time will tell, but it works well. I inserted a 128GB mini sd card and it works great. The blue color is really pretty and a little different from the seventh generation I have. What I like the most is the 32 GB instead of the 16.
customer_reviews.author: Haztive Dominicana

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Fire Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has amazing picture quality. Its very easy to navigate and use. I dislike I can't get rid of Alexa but with parental controls my kids can't use Alexa. I dislike that you have to pay more to remove the adds. There no YouTube. And I don't like that you can't uninstall certain apps that came with the tablet I also bought an SD card for more space because it fills up quickly. But overall I bought it for my.kids and they enjoy the tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Persephone

customer_reviews.title: Super slow to download books
customer_reviews.text: Takes way too long to download books and then some purchases do not show up for 30 minutes. Old Fire works much better. I do not recommend buying this model. I bought this ti read books on.
customer_reviews.author: janice thompson

customer_reviews.title: I hate this new Kindle Fire 7
customer_reviews.text: This Kindel Fire 7 is horrible. It randomly throws up some dictionary thing in the middle of the page which will only go away if I close the application and start over. The touch screen does not work about 30% of the time, again have to close and start over. I attempted to find directions somewhere to disable the dictionary thing but cannot find information anywhere. I would return it if I could figure out how to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Charell Schillo

customer_reviews.title: not loving this model
customer_reviews.text: I've owned quite a few of the base kindle fire models and generally love them. I bought this new one since my other one is having a hard time charging but this new one, while the color is pretty and it's more lightweight, has issues that have led to me letting it sit and continue using my old one. With a completely clean screen (and after taking off the case to make sure that wasn't the issue) the screen will randomly jump around and zoom in ect while trying to use it. Generally happened while reading fanfiction so using the web browser. It's really frustrating. wasn't a constant issue but happened several times before I gave up using it.
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: 2017 vs 2019
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the 7th gen this tablet is faster, has more storage, charges faster about a half an hour faster, latest fireos which is noticeable making accessories and customs easier with the down sides of fireos that can alternatively be adjusted. Also the speaker is in different location for better sound. Edit: after a few hours the 80% battery went down to 5% as well as the device being warm. Like a laptop that lasts a few hours before needing a charge.
customer_reviews.author: chanwenjin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed and discouraged
customer_reviews.text: I have been the satisfied owner of a Kindle until now. My old one recently died after years of good service. I ordered a new one which was defective on receipt. Did not hold a charge and had a flashing red screen. I exchanged this Kindle for a replacement. I cannot place the charging cord into the unit without difficulty so I do not take the cord out which is very cumbersome. I would not recommend this Kindle. I am very disappointed because I use it every day. When I got approval to return the defective one the tech rep made me feel like she was doing me a favor in approving the exchange. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy

customer_reviews.title: Apps are limited
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly so that I could read PDF files. Though there are free PDF readers available but they are not Adobe Acrobat and the Adobe reader is not available for install. I could not find a reader that had the PDF bookmark feature. Maybe there are PDF reader apps out there, other than the one from Adobe, that has the bookmark feature but i got tired of looking. This is a less than optimal solution for me. Additionally, the available apps are somewhat limited and the tablet comes with a lot of trash apps installed. I would not recommend this unless you are really really into Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: brewc

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold a wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a newer kindle, because my older one began losing its wifi connection. Well, this new one did not connect to wifi at all! So, this is the same problem as my older kindle, but at least Amazon accepted return request without any problem since it was brand new. Wonder if Amazon did any kind of quality check before shipping to me.
customer_reviews.author: C&H

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price, but too small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet because I wanted another just to have around. I would suggest, if you get this, to spend the extra $15 dollars and get it WITHOUT special offers enabled. It's a nightmare with all the pre-installed Amazon bloatware that's on it. This is why my rating is only a 3 star. Yes, you can have the bloatware removed, after paying a fee, but save yourself the time and hassle of having to do this. Also, it is too small. I would also suggest to get the 10" version, if you're going this direction.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not even worth that
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of phones, computers and tablets over the years. Out of the box, this one is the worst. You can actually watch the battery drain with just the screen on....nothing running. It is incompatible with the United Airlines app, and the Amazon App store dropped that app for this tablet (works on other Fire tablets). It can't use YouTube TV because it can't get your location. Skype can't connect any calls....constant errors. If you're looking for a color Kindle with terrible battery life and a low price....I've got your tablet right here. If you're looking to do much of anything else at all....buy another tablet. This one is simply terrible.
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: Extremely laggy device
customer_reviews.text: Slow wifi connectivity, when my wifi works fine. What I can't get over is how slow and laggy this is. For it being a new generation device it runs like a 5 year old device. So disappointing. I got this for reading and writing, so I don't use it to stream, or play games (and with how slow it os I doubt I would be able to), and yet it lags while navigating its own apps like Amazon store and even on the home screen. And there's ADs on the lockscreen? I shelled out money for this and you put ads on here?! I'm wondering if I should have gone with a kindle and if Google was a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: JumpDivine

customer_reviews.title: NOT MY OLD KINDLE FIRE!
customer_reviews.text: And that is not necessarily a good thing. I will begin by saying I'm not a "techie" and I was comfortable with the old Kindle. I don't like the constant ads which pop up and I don't like the "Home" screen setup. I don't like the size, and I sure was unhappy about the new cover. My old cover would assure that you could prop up the Kindle and read with just a touch of the screen to turn pages. The new Kindle and cover really don't even stand that well, making me hesitant to use the protective cover to prop the book because it falls over many times. Be aware....new is not always better!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Ellen

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure about the battery life because I have 3 other tablets that I use (two are old ones which still have apps that didn't transfer). I use Simple Radio a lot but it won't download on this tablet (it is on my other Fire). Apps are listed but I can't get them to show on the home screen, which they did on my previous 4 Fires. I think this one is harder to understand and it is very slow in switching to my own facebook page. It just seems slower in general. I thought that it would be really fast and zippy. Can't say I'm 100% in love with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Love the smaller size, but text to speech does not work
customer_reviews.text: So happy they are offering a smaller tablet. I listen to books using text to speech function. That way I can listen to the book while walking However, the text to speech does not work. I have tried 3 separate devices, and none of them worked. If you read the forum, other people also having this same problem
customer_reviews.author: hlr

customer_reviews.title: Technical Support is Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Very shortly after writing a negative Review on this fine product, I received a phone call From Jeremy on the Amazon Tech Support. Jeremy at Tech Support was very sympathetic to my Problem with SD Card compatibility. Turns out it my be a software update that is needed. Problem will be resolved Tomorrow when I can get Internet access. Jeremy is Very Professional and Courteous, as well as Knowledgeable. Jeremy IS the Reason I am staying with Amazon (I was ready to quit doing any and all business with Amazon). Thanks a Billion Jeremy😃. -Iven Rossall Pahrump, Nevada✌
customer_reviews.author: Iven Rossall

customer_reviews.title: seems different from the older 8Gb ver
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an older 8Gb ver and the new one seems faster BUT it also seems to treat my sd card differently and doesn't recall my recently used apps after it's been closed like the old 1 did. Overall I'm happy because the larger storage allows the side loading of Google Play with room to spare where the old 1 was quite full afterwards. :-) Edit:After the recent software update (10/2020) the apps are being recalled as before and things seem to be working as normal.The shutting off option has changed a little in the new software(added a screenshot option)and that makes it even nicer!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S

customer_reviews.title: Tablet Nice but No Synch ability
customer_reviews.text: I discovered I was unable to synch my new tablet with my Paperwhite reader as I could with previous Kindle Fire. The technician said he couldn't do it, and others he talked to couldn't synch either. That's a definite bummer because I like to use both my Kindle Fire and Paperwhite to read the same book. My paperwhite is lighter and easier to use while reading in bed. The Fire I take with me to work in case I need to use the internet, and like to read if I have a chance.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bartles

customer_reviews.title: This Upgrade is a Downgrade
customer_reviews.text: I thought an upgrade didn't mean a decrease in functionality. The reduced battery life is really annoying. It does charge faster than my prior Kindle, but the shorter battery life causes me to re-charge more frequently during the day. A faster charge is nice, but doesn't make up for the inconvenience of the lousy battery life. You would think that with advances in technology, particularly in batteries, a new Kindle would at least be able to maintain prior version functionality. The other features are just as good as my prior Kindle so I'm happy with that, but next time I upgrade I doubt it will be another Kindle. Btw, I refuse to use Alexa due to data privacy issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: Fire 7 Not too bad...worth the trade in
customer_reviews.text: It's the same functionality except the speaker is on the side instead of the bottom. I had a case for the 5th gen and it fits fine minus the speaker placement but if you have it open it doesn't matter. I noticed the earphone jack is REALLY tight so it takes some effort to get it out. The screen saver is now an ad for a random game which is interactive but only takes a normal swipe up to get past it. It seems to be a little more responsive in games as far as loading and processing. So far no complaints. Four stars just because I don't want to over rate it, I haven't used it that much.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW

customer_reviews.title: Screen stopped working after 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my mom. She really liked the one I had and appreciated the ease of use. After 2.5 months the screen started to freeze. I reset it to the factory settings, deregistered it...all the things the support for this product advised. It would work for a few minutes only to freeze up again. The last time I attempted to reset it, the screen advised the account had been locked. Sending it back for a replacement. Hopefully it won't be a lemon too!
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great buy 😍
customer_reviews.text: Not sure on battery life yet but I bought it for my nephew who lives in the Caribbean who soon turn 2 for him to watch kid shows & play games . They have parental control which is great & they have a screen for adults so your able to switch profiles . You definitely need an amazon account linked to this tablet I had to make one in order for my sister & nephew to use . I would suggest purchasing a screen protector & case for this tablet . They are selling it in stores for $20-30 more & insurance $20 more so this was definitely a great buy .
customer_reviews.author: Ri

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Saw the deals this season and figured I'd jump on the opportunity to update our Kindles. Should have waited...these newer versions can only do a Max of 24-28 hr in standby and then you need to recharge. The old one (2017 version) could at least do several days. I have yet to see the issue of it reloading my books but it's only been a few days. It is nice that I don't have to wait 2-4 minutes each time I power it up for it to reload/download all my books. Not sure it's worth the sacrifice though in battery....
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: So bad even my child doesn’t want to use it
customer_reviews.text: I am very surprised by how awful this tablet is. I can’t believe the good reviews. I wonder if those people have never used an actual functioning tablet. This thing is so slow. The screen freezes. A lot of apps look weird on it but look fine on our other tablet. The battery life is awful. I started a return but instead of returning it to UPS the way I do most things, I had to print the label and package it myself and just ran out of time. This tablet is so bad that even my 6 year old doesn’t pick it up to play with it. That should tell you everything you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: robbiegrl

customer_reviews.title: The kindle came with a broken power cord
customer_reviews.text: Once I used a charging cable that did not come with the Kindle, it charged right up. The screen is crystal clear. Despite being connected to a high speed wifi system, the Kindle is a bit slow to move from app to app and to start up. The kindle came with a plug that worked, kindle that worked, and a power cord that did not work. I needed to de-register and re-register it several times to see all of my family's profiles. If you don't get it on a super duper deal, look for another tablet. It's not really worth the $50.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this device, all I really wanted was a reader, in which to store my e-books and to be able to read them. The Fire 7 is a lot more than that, but most of its other features take more time to figure out that they're worth. I like an illustrated instruction booklet that I can have next to my Fire while I go through the motions of doing this stuff. Having instructions that I have to delete from the screen while I try to recreate them for use is error-filled and frustrating. I guess I'll just read my books and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Grantham

customer_reviews.title: Memory issues
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this thing works. I have a micro SD card in it and there is nothing saved on it. There is nothing in my library, there is nothing in my gallery, I have no music on it. I have virtually NOTHING stored on it and it keeps telling me that I am out of memory. On line help has not resolved the issue. Totally annoying to get "You have memory issues" warnings every few minutes while using it. The cord from the power cube is so short you confined to the immediate area of the power cube while recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Rex A Schildhouse

customer_reviews.title: Choking on Amazon Apps
customer_reviews.text: I expected a bit of branding and pre-installed Amazon based apps to be part of this fire tablet. However there is an excessive amount of Amazon Apps on the this tablet, none of which can be uninstalled. My main reason for buying this tablet was to read E-books. The price was right and I thought that having a Kindle tablet would be the best way to experience all the books I had bought on Amazon. Sadly, the app feels way more cluttered then the version I had on android. Once this tablet breaks, I will be going back to an android tablet.
customer_reviews.author: JMW

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: The first one we ordered didn't work so we sent it back and ordered another one. You are supposed to hold the start button down when it boots up and it will go to the Amazon screen but they were both stuck on the first Android one. We called for assistance and if they make a ticket for help then you can't return the item. You think the item would be checked for quality before it left the factory. We have been purchasing them for our grandchildren but won't bother trying again.
customer_reviews.author: Catwoman

customer_reviews.title: Fire 7 with adds might be fixed now.
customer_reviews.text: Within an hour of setting up the device, and logging into my google and amazon accounts, both had an attempted login from a computer in Pakistan. If you are going to buy one, do not get the adds, since Amazon seems to be letting others see your logins. Edit. Had to replace it. The screen had blotches after sitting in my car at 30 degrees Fahrenheit. The new one seems fine. Not sure what the deal was with the old one. Amazon tech support was very interested in this device to make sure everything was secure. I am sure they have taken care of whatever security issue that caused the password problem.
customer_reviews.author: Trixter

customer_reviews.title: Yay!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect so I can keep my phone. My grandson always wanted to play games, so me and my husband would alternate our phones. Now he’s got the tablet so no more killing or battery and missed calls or texts. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: THERE ARE MORE FEATURES AVAILABLE ON THE NEW FIRE 7 THAN THE PREVIOUS.
customer_reviews.text: I basically use this model to read my Kindle Electronic books and for the internet when needed. The keyboard is still inferior and hard to use. It makes emailing very difficult so that feature is basically useless as far as I am concerned. Luckily, I have 2 other devices to use when I need to use a keyboard feature. Alexa is now available on this new Fire however I cannot sync it to my Echo Device .
customer_reviews.author: mehlad

customer_reviews.title: This was a replacement and an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kindle 7 and loved it for reading and audibles.. I broke it. This Fire 7 tablet takes some adjustments on my part. I am annoyed that Amazon is always advertising on what ever category I'm using. I use Amazon a lot for other things and happy to. I just don't need them trying to guess what I will want to read and/hear or play games, etc. try to sell it to me. Otherwise it is sleek, picture clear, colorful, quick. I would like to turn the volume on audible up a bit more. So far I haven't found anything that does that except to connect to a speaker.
customer_reviews.author: PhylDav

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Children
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. They're cheap, so I didn't expect much. The camera quality isn't great, at all. And they don't have much memory, so if you buy this, I highly suggest getting a memory card. You'll regret it if you don't. They also take forever to charge. However, the battery lasts for quite a while. So it's worth the wait. This is perfect for small children and teenagers. It's lightweight, the quality is crisp and it has some cool features.
customer_reviews.author: Princess S. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a tablet for awhile now, but I have not seen one that I liked with the features that I wanted. Imagine my surprise, when I saw this! It fits all my needs and the color I wanted (my favorite color is blue)!! Very easy to use and set up. Took just a few minutes to set up and I was enjoying my new tablet! I mainly use it to read my digital books, but it can do so much more!! Very happy with it and would recommend and buy again if I needed another one!!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Comes with Ads on Lock Screen
customer_reviews.text: I like amazon products, such as their AA batteries, their wireless mouse and their keyboards and chairs, but these tablets are just horrible. Who would buy a tablet that comes with ads which is saved onto lock screen and eats so tons of data? It's removable only if you pay money to remove it, so dumb, they should have it placed as "Comes with Ad" not hidden and show as is.... The tablet only allows amazon type software and ruins the whole point of having a tablet...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: It’s the same size as my other Fire tablets, which I’ve been happy using. I mostly play games on it and the size is large enough to see the screen well, yet small enough to avoid hand-cramps. It’s good for watching videos as well. It has a crisp picture and the sound is fine. It has a standard pin jack and works with my headphones. I’m very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol-n-Conway

customer_reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise!
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleasantly impressed at the quality of the display, the upgradability of the memory, the quickness of performing tasks. The light weight (compared to my old iPad) makes this very practical for reading, and the color display makes reading books which have graphs and illustrations much more pleasurable than trying to read them on my Kindle Touch. My only gripe is that it's proving impossible for me to get documents and music transferred over from my Mac. The suggested iOs app doesn't recognize the Kindle Fire's been connected, thus there can be no transfer. I'll just have to figure out another way, including trying this from my wife's Windows computer. I'm please, very pleased, with this Kindle Fire 7!
customer_reviews.author: Longrower
